@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Style querying and modification of HTML elements.

Automatically normalizes cross-browser differences for setting and reading
CSS attributes. Optimized for performance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Gets the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name of a style property and stores
it to avoid multiple checks.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} Style property name to check
@param.description: Style property name to check

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} The client-specific name of the property, or null if it's not supported.
@return.description: The client-specific name of the property, or null if it's not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Mshtml has proprietary pixel* properties for locations and dimensions
which return the pixel value. Used by getComputed() in mshtml variant.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether a special class is available for the processing of this style.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Compiles the given styles into a string which can be used to
concat a HTML string for innerHTML usage.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: map {Map} Map of style properties to compile
@param.description: Map of style properties to compile

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} Compiled string of given style properties.
@return.description: Compiled string of given style properties.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the full CSS content of the style attribute

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} The DOM element to modify
@param.description: The DOM element to modify

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {String} The full CSS string
@param.description: The full CSS string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the full content of the style attribute.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} The DOM element to query
@param.description: The DOM element to query

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks whether the browser supports the given CSS property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: propertyName {String} The name of the property
@param.description: The name of the property

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} Computed value of a style property. Compared to the cascaded style, this one also interprets the values e.g. translates em units to px.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} Cascaded value of a style property.

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{Integer} Local value of a style property. Ignores inheritance cascade.
Does not interpret values.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the value of a style property

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} The DOM element to modify
@param.description: The DOM element to modify

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} Name of the style attribute (js variant e.g. marginTop, wordSpacing)
@param.description: Name of the style attribute (js variant e.g. marginTop, wordSpacing)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var} The value for the given style
@param.description: The value for the given style

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
smart {Boolean?true} Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties
@param.description:
Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Convenience method to modify a set of styles at once.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} The DOM element to modify
@param.description: The DOM element to modify

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
styles {Map} a map where the key is the name of the property
and the value is the value to use.
@param.description:
a map where the key is the name of the property
and the value is the value to use.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
smart {Boolean?true} Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties
@param.description:
Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the value of a style property

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} The DOM element to modify
@param.description: The DOM element to modify

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} Name of the style attribute (js variant e.g. marginTop, wordSpacing)
@param.description: Name of the style attribute (js variant e.g. marginTop, wordSpacing)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
smart {Boolean?true} Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties
@param.description:
Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the value of a style property. *Computed* Returns the computed value of a style property. Compared to the cascaded style, this one also interprets the values e.g. translates em units to px. *Cascaded* Returns the cascaded value of a style property. *Local* Ignores inheritance cascade. Does not interpret values.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} The DOM element to modify
@param.description: The DOM element to modify

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} Name of the style attribute (js variant e.g. marginTop, wordSpacing)
@param.description: Name of the style attribute (js variant e.g. marginTop, wordSpacing)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
mode {Number} Choose one of the modes {@link #COMPUTED_MODE}, {@link #CASCADED_MODE},
{@link #LOCAL_MODE}. The computed mode is the default one.
@param.description:
Choose one of the modes {@link #COMPUTED_MODE}, {@link #CASCADED_MODE},
{@link #LOCAL_MODE}. The computed mode is the default one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
smart {Boolean?true} Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties
@param.description:
Whether the implementation should automatically use
special implementations for some properties
